children.text: When I started learning swift I realized that just learning it is useless! So when I started creating this app I started with high hopes!

text: Do not code without knowing the What and Why of it!

children.text: It’s always good to have a bigger picture of what and why you are going to code. It makes you think: “Is this feature required? & Why is it required? If yes, is there an effective way? If no, why not? Am I the best programmer to do this? Should I consult with other team members who may have a similar requirement?

Many times you will see yourself overloaded with work. You need to study to prioritize it; i.e. which task to jump for the while & which task to focus more on, or, whether you can do tasks parallelly. It will come gradually though. This improves a lot with experience.

There are two main problems with statics: Thread Safety – static resources are by definition not thread-safe. Code Implicity – You don’t know when a static variable is instantiated & whether or not it will be instantiated before another static variable.

text: Always go till the last answer in Stack Overflow!

children.text: It happened to me many times when the top-voted answer didn’t work for me but a solution from the end worked like a champ. So, I always advise programmers to try other solutions in Stackoverflow as well, instead of only marked or top voted.

text: Never hesitate to ask for solutions!

children.text: I have seen many junior programmers in organizations feel shame while they stuck in errors. In coding, most of the errors occur due to very little mistakes. So, never hesitate. I repeat never hesitate to ask for the solution to seniors. There are chances that your senior had already faced the same issue & could help you to quickly solve the issue.

This app was made by an elite team of amazing developers, who have made it their mission to build this amazing app. This is no mere app: this app has tells you about where everyone lives a little bit about them and most importantly, about Galileo and Coding Pro!
